channel.title: My Compiler won't work... >.>
channel.description:
All right... I just downloaded the Deltascape Source... and for some odd reason, my Compiler doesn't work. I'll type exactly what my compiler says when I try to run it. Here it is: "The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue..._" This is my first time trying to create a server... I helped a friend once, he had a DeltaScape Source... it's Compiler worked fine. So.. I'm utterly confused. I'll even show you what the Compiler says when you right click it's file and hit "edit". Here it is: "@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause ". All gibberish to me. There's also a little text file that says "compile"... so I'll open that through Notepad and tell you what it says... Here it is: "#!/bin/bash
# Tested with: SuSE Linux 10.0 # Requires java path be stored in $PATH
# Usage: # Enter the following in terminal before first usage: # "chmod +x compile.sh && chmod +x run.sh
javac -classpath . -d bin *.java -g". Yet again... utterly incomprehensable. So if you have any ideas to why my Compiler isn't working.. feel free to reply... it would help me out quite a bit. Thanks.
-Volcanic Me.

item.title: My Compiler won't work... >.>
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

[quote=“Volcanic Me, post:10, topic:239311”]Ok… I did what Goth Wolf said… now my Compiler says:
“client.java:450 ‘;’ expected
server.npcHandler.spawnANPC<2741, 2381, 5106, heightLevel>
1 error
Press any key to continue…”
What does that mean? Lol.[/quote]
you forgot your semi colon.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Volcanic_Me wrote:

Sweet… feel like helping me fix the error? I’m t0t4l n00b at this, lol. xD
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2008, 11:15:53 pm[/size][hr]Oh, and thanks guys, you’ve really helped me. :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2008, 11:27:45 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind, got it, thanks again, you guys are lifesavers!

item.title: My Compiler won't work... >.>
item.dc:creator: @Volcanic_Me Volcanic Me
item.description:
@Volcanic_Me wrote:

All right… I just downloaded the Deltascape Source… and for some odd reason, my Compiler doesn’t work. I’ll type exactly what my compiler says when I try to run it.
Here it is: “The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue…_”
This is my first time trying to create a server… I helped a friend once, he had a DeltaScape Source… it’s Compiler worked fine. So… I’m utterly confused. I’ll even show you what the Compiler says when you right click it’s file and hit “edit”. Here it is: "@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause ".
All gibberish to me. There’s also a little text file that says “compile”… so I’ll open that through Notepad and tell you what it says… Here it is: "#!/bin/bash

Tested with: SuSE Linux 10.0

Requires java path be stored in $PATH

Usage:

Enter the following in terminal before first usage:

"chmod +x compile.sh && chmod +x run.sh

javac -classpath . -d bin *.java -g".
Yet again… utterly incomprehensable. So if you have any ideas to why my Compiler isn’t working… feel free to reply… it would help me out quite a bit. Thanks.

                           -Volcanic Me.

Read full topic
